publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1747 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Greenock Emigration Museum—That the Parliament recognises the positive impact made throughout the world by the more than two million Scots who have emigrated from this country; notes with interest the proposals for a Scottish Emigration Museum based in Greenock to celebrate those who have left to begin new lives in the rest of the world; acknowledges the potential financial benefits such a visitor attraction would have for Greenock and the surrounding area, and calls on Greater Glasgow and Clyde Valley Tourist Board to work with all interested parties to consider this proposal.
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Alex Neil*, Michael Matheson*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1747 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Greenock Emigration Museum—That the Parliament recognises the positive impact made throughout the world by the more than two million Scots who have emigrated from this country; notes with interest the proposals for a Scottish Emigration Museum based in Greenock to celebrate those who have left to begin new lives in the rest of the world; acknowledges the potential financial benefits such a visitor attraction would have for Greenock and the surrounding area, and calls on Greater Glasgow and Clyde Valley Tourist Board to work with all interested parties to consider this proposal. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Mr Alex Salmond*, Michael Russell*, Tommy Sheridan*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1747 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Greenock Emigration Museum—That the Parliament recognises the positive impact made throughout the world by the more than two million Scots who have emigrated from this country; notes with interest the proposals for a Scottish Emigration Museum based in Greenock to celebrate those who have left to begin new lives in the rest of the world; acknowledges the potential financial benefits such a visitor attraction would have for Greenock and the surrounding area, and calls on Greater Glasgow and Clyde Valley Tourist Board to work with all interested parties to consider this proposal. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Linda Fabiani, Mr Alex Salmond, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Brian Adam*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1747 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Greenock Emigration Museum—That the Parliament recognises the positive impact made throughout the world by the more than two million Scots who have emigrated from this country; notes with interest the proposals for a Scottish Emigration Museum based in Greenock to celebrate those who have left to begin new lives in the rest of the world; acknowledges the potential financial benefits such a visitor attraction would have for Greenock and the surrounding area, and calls on Greater Glasgow and Clyde Valley Tourist Board to work with all interested parties to consider this proposal. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Linda Fabiani, Mr Alex Salmond, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam, Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1747 Greenock Emigration Museum (lodged on 13 March 2001) Colin Campbell*
